value.title: DAX! Uggg - Where do you start? | Power BI
value.excerpt: Not a coder? Don't understand DAX syntax? DAX can be intimidating and difficult to learn. Frustrating even! Learning DAX can make Power BI very rewarding. Adam has some resources to get you started in your journey.  Beginning the journey:  MS Learn: User DAX in Power BI Desktop (Free) https://docs.microsoft.com/learn/paths/dax-power-bi/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/3gpXMMRJjw8" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: EASILY create a Hierarchy in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Learn to easily create a hierarchy in Power BI. This seems to be a new way that snuck into Power BI Desktop!  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want to take your Power BI skills to the next level? We have training courses available to help you with your journey.

value.title: FAST - Billions of rows with Azure Data Explorer (ADX)
value.excerpt: Have you tried Azure Data Explorer? We look at how ADX can support large amounts of data and query at blazing fast speeds. it truly is BANANAS! And you can try it for FREE!  Connect with Tzvia: https://www.linkedin.com/in/tzvia/ https://twitter.com/tzvia  What is Azure Data Explorer? https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/data-explorer-overview

value.title: Filter Power BI reports using a URL query string
value.excerpt: In this video, I show you how to filter Power BI reports, within the Power BI service, using a URL query string.  This is actually documented here - https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/powerbi-service-share-unshare-dashboard/#share-just-a-report  In addition to showing you how to filter

value.title: How Parameters work with the Power BI Paginated Visual
value.excerpt: Parameters for the Power BI Paginated visual can give you a lot of flexibility. Adam walks you through how to set up the parameters and breaks down what is actually happening with the values.  Create and use the paginated report visual https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/visuals/paginated-report-visual

value.title: How we optimize Power Query and Power BI Dataflows

Power Query M function reference https://docs.microsoft.com/powerquery-m/power-query-m-function-reference  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Install and configure Power BI Report Server (May 2017 Preview)
value.excerpt: In this video, I look at how to install and configure the May 2017 Preview of Power BI Report Server. Power BI Report Server has a new standalone install experience and this product allows for Power BI reports to be rendered in the web portal along with paginated reports.  This will get you started with

value.title: Natives Queries or ODBC with Incremental Refresh in Power BI

value.title: Parameters and Templates with Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows a way you can use parameters and templates, with Power BI Desktop, to provide prompts for your connection's server and database properties.   This is great for when you are creating a report, and need to share it with a customer that may have a different name for the server

value.excerpt: With Log Analytics integration in Power BI, you can now capture Analysis Services trace events easily and over a longer period of time. value.title: How to Show Items with No Data in Power BI (e.g. Show All Month Names)
value.excerpt: Sometimes the default behavior in Power BI can be frustrating. For example, if you are showing month names, you may see that if no data is available then those months may not be shown in your Chart or Table. Often, you would want all months (Jan-Dec) to be shown, regardless of whether data is present
